              ["Take a look at the “makeSum” function. It receives two "],
              ["int", [["c"]]],
              [" parameters that need to be converted to C "],
              ["int", [["c"]]],
              [" before by using the "],
              ["C.int", [["c"]]],
              [" function. Also, the return of the call will give us a C "],
              ["int", [["c"]]],
              [
                " and an error in case something went wrong. We need to cast C response to a Go’s int using "
              ],
              ["int()", [["c"]]],

      "d6aa111c-e6fa-40f3-967b-1466208df355": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1532156201279,
          "id": "d6aa111c-e6fa-40f3-967b-1466208df355",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1532156201279,
          "parent_id": "ed4cda13-d798-4045-b853-28a8d76211e5",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "//main.go\npackage main\n\n/*\n  #include \"hello.c\"\n  #include \"sum.c\"\n*/\nimport \"C\"\n\n\nfunc main() {\n    //Call to void function without params\n    err := Hello()\n    if err != nil {\n        log.Fatal(err)\n    }\n}\n\n//Hello is a C binding to the Hello World \"C\" program. As a Go user you could\n//use now the Hello function transparently without knowing that it is calling\n//a C function\nfunc Hello() error {\n    _, err := C.Hello()    //We ignore first result as it is a void function\n    if err != nil {\n        return errors.New(\"error calling Hello function: \" + err.Error())\n    }\n\n    return nil\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 1
        }

      "e0c62685-dcfe-4a2e-8425-812e8420bbf1": {
        "role": "comment_only",
        "value": {
          "alive": true,
          "created_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "created_by_table": "notion_user",
          "created_time": 1532156201280,
          "id": "e0c62685-dcfe-4a2e-8425-812e8420bbf1",
          "ignore_block_count": true,
          "last_edited_by": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_id": "bb760e2d-d679-4b64-b2a9-03005b21870a",
          "last_edited_by_table": "notion_user",
          "last_edited_time": 1532156201280,
          "parent_id": "ed4cda13-d798-4045-b853-28a8d76211e5",
          "parent_table": "block",
          "properties": {
            "language": [["Plain Text"]],
            "title": [
              [
                "//main.go\npackage main\n\n/*\n#include \"hello.c\"\n#include \"sum.c\"\n*/\nimport \"C\"\n\nimport (\n    \"errors\"\n    \"fmt\"\n    \"log\"\n)\n\nfunc main() {\n    //Call to void function without params\n    err := Hello()\n    if err != nil {\n        log.Fatal(err)\n    }\n\n    //Call to int function with two params\n    res, err := makeSum(5, 4)\n    if err != nil {\n        log.Fatal(err)\n    }\n\n    fmt.Printf(\"Sum of 5 + 4 is %d\\n\", res)\n}\n\n//Hello is a C binding to the Hello World \"C\" program. As a Go user you could\n//use now the Hello function transparently without knowing that is calling a C\n//function\nfunc Hello() error {\n    _, err := C.Hello() //We ignore first result as it is a void function\n    if err != nil {\n        return errors.New(\"error calling Hello function: \" + err.Error())\n    }\n\n    return nil\n}\n\n//makeSum also is a C binding to make a sum. As before it returns a result and\n//an error. Look that we had to pass the Int values to C.int values before using\n//the function and cast the result back to a Go int value\nfunc makeSum(a, b int) (int, error) {\n    //Convert Go ints to C ints\n    aC := C.int(a)\n    bC := C.int(b)\n\n    sum, err := C.sum(aC, bC)\n    if err != nil {\n        return 0, errors.New(\"error calling Sum function: \" + err.Error())\n    }\n\n    //Convert C.int result to Go int\n    res := int(sum)\n\n    return res, nil\n}"
              ]
            ]
          },
          "space_id": "cf9fa7dd-b245-42a0-b929-d5a276b3afe0",
          "type": "code",
          "version": 5
        }
      },
